comments.content: Something to think about. This is her home & you want her to learn about it. I never baby proofed per se but just pulled up what was dangerous. So chemicals went above the washer. I made sure magnet closures on cabinets were good & if not then I made sure what was in them wasn't bad. And I watched the stairs & made sure they were ok. We all learn by mistake. Good luck mama whatever you decide  😀

comments.content: # ProudPipettinPimp   Why is microbiology the most gangsta place to work?...  ... See More
ZDoggMD  how do you come up with these songs man! Ha!

Woot Woot ... shout out to all my lab colleagues. Because we can boldly say that without us doing what we do, all those hospitals have is one big ass clinic! Hahahahaha. Twenty eight years of reppin the lab here and I am neither bored nor tired of it. ... See More

thank you for recognizing us! soo many in the hospital think we come off the streets.. push buttons.. they are always surprise we have a bachelor degree and internship..taking certification, test, ceus.. soo.. to see the lab in action.. some may see we r complex!
LOVE this! reminds me of all the times I had to go down to the lab and relabel samples, sometimes cause there was no birt'day!!!
Maybe an Eminem parody about urinalysis next 'Without Pee?' Gotta love those 'change in mental status' admits with no UA, etc. ... See More
I downloaded this off iTunes so I could blast it in my car and sing along- people probably think I'm weird but oh well- I work in da lab anyways it's expected  😂

Dedicated to all my lab buddies!  This brings back memories, especially getting the call that the specimen was hemolyzed, or the dreaded call that "someone" didn't screw the cap on the urine tight enough!
I have been going to the lab a lot in the past 2 years. They are part of the team & help to make my experience positive. I always make sure I tell them how much I appreciate their TLC.
We in the lab all the time, so pop red tops homie!  I don't even remember the lyrics to the original song anymore.  # lab4life

Will Pridmore  everything i know about you I'm disappointed in myself for not thinking of this sooner, this guy is your spirit animal, like his page, watch a few vids and catch him when he's live which is quite often and you will understand why  😂
Dr ZDogg. You need to do one just for Anatomic Pathology/Histology!!!  In Da Lab is one of my favorites!!

It's great being a biochemist or microbiologists . Many people outside medical field do not know that, most of the success of medical team lies on the analysis from the lab from these two great departments.

I absolutely love this!  You hit on some real stuff that's dealt with in the lab like mis labeled specimens . Let me tell you nothing ticks someone off like a rejected specimen . In our hospital sometimes it feels like the lab and phlebs are forgotten so thank you for bringing us some light!
Jamin Williams . Was able to tell everyone around me in class what the BMP and CMP codes were, what the sample carriers were, stability, and what's included in the tests lol
LMAO! This reminds me of when I tried to help Katie Gee out by sending her labs down one night...I did not get the protocol correct.
Haha this is classic. You never cease to amaze me with these. Just when I think you couldnt do any better you come up with this hahahaha.
LOL!! LOVE THESE!! You need to make a CD so us HOME CARE NURSES have somethin to bump through the hood... hahaha
That takes some "mad skills" to rap like that! I bet that took a lot of practice to get this one down! You rock!
Come with solid stool for C diff I'll send you back! This guy got it down pat. Love it!
I can watch this over and over! Love it every time! Thanks for representing the lab!!   😘 😉
I friggin love this shizzz! I use your SoundCloud as my workout tunes. I get some looks but I give zero shits.  LAB IS LIFE!! Lab Rats Rule
This was going thru my head the other nite while working (microbiology lab) but I kept singing "pocket full o crap"  😂 😂 😂
My least fave call is the specimen was hemolized especially on a hard stick.

comments.content: I don't think we can ignore another thing that's beautiful about this ad, that his granddaughter is multiracial.  Given the growing nationalism and backlash against immigrants in Poland, too, that sends an awesome message.
Made me weepy. The unexpected f-bomb (way before the sweet weepy part) was hilarious!

As a grandmother of a very diverse family, Thank You! Those that are carrying your DNA to the next phase of life, is Love at its  highest form. Beautiful. My grandsons are Samoan, White, Black, Latino and Chinese  ❤️  They are the future.

I run a webseries where I cook with diverse grandmothers (since no matter your culture/race/language, we ALL love our grandmas), and this commercial was so beautiful! Check out the series on  www.CookingWithGranny.TV.  We're actually running a free grandma-curated food box giveaway for the holidays so you can sign up for that, too!
Simply awesome. An ad that makes you feel and reflect about compassion in a highly interconnected world. We all can learn from & for each other.
Well . . . just for those sensitive viewers, you might want to mention that it does have a four letter word in it. It doesn't bother me, but I know you like to warn your audience.
This is one of my favourite commercials right now!  As someone who has had to learn a second language it brought back a lot of memories. Gave me all the feels.
Oh my. This is a bright spot-his willingness to learn, their careful preparation, and the overall amount of acceptance and love is what special moments and a good life are made of.
Great ad for all reasons stated. I loved the fact that this older man was learning a new language - a life long learner. Good for him.
Much better than the one with the old bastard who fakes his death to get a visit.

Economy is in ruin, people are running away, and neo-nazis have long seized the government and now sucking euros like a vacuum from the EU, screaming "The Russians are coming". But no one is buying their bs any more, certainly not the British. They should kick those Poles out, they have a country in the EU. What more do they need?

comments.content: I oppose the merger on antitrust merits, but even more, I oppose the thinly veiled assault on CNN by a demagogue.

I don't know if there is good reason or not to block the sale.  However, if Trump is influencing the DOJ's decision that certainly seems blatantly illegal.  Of course, they will deny any influence, but who knows, a staffer may have info to the contrary and decide to have a little chat with Mueller.

description: NPR President Trump previously indicated he might seek to thwart the AT&T/Time Warner deal over antitrust concerns. Yet he has been far more vocal about his anger at CNN, which is owned by Time Warner.

I'm so sorry for your family's loss. Sending prayers to your family that the memories and love you shared will sustain you in this difficult time.

Benjamin Bakall  mIna och Annas varmaste hälsningar, och kondoleanser, till dig och familjen. Du vet att Julia och jag var kurskamrater och jag fick på det och andra sätt lära känna din mamma rätt väl. Hon var alltid så hjälpsam och vänlig även de gånger hon själv inte hade det helt lätt.  <3

Verkligen tråkigt Benny! Jag minns henne som en varm o omtänksam människa. På sista tiden hade vi också lite kontakt på fb - hon brukade dela mkt Israel- vänliga artiklar som jag uppskattade som motvikt mot den extrema  pro-Palestinska bild vi oftast får här i Sverige. Verkligen tråkigt med cancern.

description: Benjamin Bakall  added  5 new photos  — with  Andrea Bakall  and  Emma Bakall . My mother Julia passed away 2 weeks ago from incurable gallbladder cancer diagnosed only 2 months prior. She dearly loved all her children and grandchildren and always sent a birthday card. She was very active and had many interests and hobbies, and sang in a choir until the end. We spent a nice week with her a month ago in Stockholm.   My dear mom will be greatly missed. Benjamin Bakall

comments.content: A friend of my Dad’s, who was a builder, would always fall asleep within minutes of his home train moving, and he would invariably miss his stop. So he got a carpenter friend of his to make an engraved sign on a chain, which read “Please wake me at Ha ... See More
Best part of this is that it was premeditated. She printed it and got a plastic cover with a clip for it!
I'm getting older and am likely to fall asleep in odd places. Can I just put this on and wear it all the time?
The sign:
Doesn't look like anyone has read Terry Pratchett's Discworld novels. I was expecting at least one comment reffering to Granny Weatherwax and her sign that says "I aten't dead."

Once on my way back from a busy trip, I was exhausted and asked the flight attendant to only wake me up if we needed to jump off the plane.  I was asleep before we took off, landed in Toronto took off again then landed in Montreal without me waking up. ... See More
When I flew with Etihad in 2014 they gave everyone an eyemask with "Do not disturb" on one side and "Please wake me for food" on the other side, in English and in Arabic. I still use that.
I remember seeing college kids sleeping in chairs at the student center. They had signs on them with a time, asking to wake them up at that time
When you get premium economy on Turkish Airlines, you get a little ditty bag than aside from the eye mask, earplugs, toothbrush/toothpaste, includes a Velcro backed sign that says “wake/sleep”.
I'm getting this tattooed on my forehead, engraved on a med alert bracelet, and monogrammed on my pillow. # pleasewakemeforsnacksandmealsandnobodygetshurt
I did get a snack and drink for my napping seat neighbor once-she was so surprised. But who wouldn't want to wake up to a snack?  🤗  No brainer.

Years ago (like 20 years) some airlines handed out stickers that said ‘please wake for meals’ that you could stick on yourself or your seat...  I kept some and used them in my home life until they lost their stickiness...

My mom can fall asleep ANYWHERE, when I was 4 the fam went to Spain, we had a layover in Switzerland, at the Swiss airport she legit looked at my big bro, he would have been 18, and said “I’m taking a nap, watch Jess”, and then closed her eyes, just like that, I have never seen such a look of terror in my bro’s face, he thought she was unconscious
Sadly, the guy with a "Please wake me for Mile High Club induction" sign woke up to a ginger ale dumped in his lap, and rubber chicken gravy smeared on his forehead.

My sign would say, "fuck your drinks and snacks, wake me up and die", because I am chronically unable to sleep on a plane like a normal person, and anyone who interferes with my attempt will incur insomnia induced wrath
Kate Matchett  I needed this on the way home from Europe seeing as I couldn't trust you to wake me up for the Mars Bar. I'll never forgive you.
I once sat with a boy on the plane who told me to wake him for food.  He didn't tell me he took a sleeping pill.  I woke him but he was too sleepy to eat his dessert.  I ate it.  My mom was shocked!
Lol, no! Actually lol!!! But, I can hear a beverage cart at 20’ and jolt awake, especially if I’m flying international and alcohol is free!
We got small flyers in a guest pack for an overseas airline. Depending how you fold it, the sign says, Wake me for drinks or Wake me for dinner. or Don't wake me. Seemed very helpful.

We just got back from a trip overseas and the courtesy package they gave each passenger included a reversible eye-mask.  One side said "Do not disturb" and the other side said "Please wake me for meals." Why don't other airlines do something similar? Perhaps an extra light switch or something?
I'm amazed at the simple minded people who can fall asleep on an airplane.  You really have to have not much ticking up there to do that.
I don’t have this issue, because I can’t sleep on planes. Even on long international flights. One of the side effects of being 6’5” and crammed into the row like a sardine, I guess.
She's my hero.  I fell asleep on a redeye. Missed my food and woke up hangry.  All I could get was one bag of peanuts and I wasn't nasty to the flight attendants.

My last trip a flight attendant woke me up to see if I wanted a drink, I didn’t,  but then couldn’t get back to sleep.. There needs to be some generally accepted way to let them know.  One airline I flew on long ago gave people stickers to put on their arm if they didn’t want to be woken

You know it would help people overall to know if you did or didn't wanted to be woken. I experienced both. A. Missing the snack by being asleep and really wanted it. That sucked because I was super bummed and starving when I woke up. B. So freakin' tir ... See More
Hold on. My sign said, "Will wake for food." ... See More
Eh when I flew on Emirates a few years back they had little stickers to put on the top of your seat to say do not disturb or please wake me for meals.
They have stickers like this on emirates, you stick them to your seat or at least the did years ago when I went to Australia. I’m really surprised that I’ve never seen them with any other airline!

Once on a cross-US flight, I sat next to another woman around my age. We hit it off well and had a nice chat. She was awake for the first round of drinks and snacks, but slept through the second. I made sure to reorder her the same thing. She was very  ... See More
I've done this before. If you don't the fuckers skip over you and you end up starving after a 14 hour flight

Years ago when I lived on Twin Peaks I had to take the Corbett loop bus from Castro and Market.  On a cold rainy night, I got on the bus, and apparently made the loop  a few times.  The driver came to the back, jostled my shoulder and asked me how many times I wanted to go around for 25 cents.
I think all flights should have this.  I flew...emirates I think it was where we had stickers that said something like this.  Definitely useful!
Usually tho if you’re asleep and you miss your dinner you can just get it later I think people forget that.  (Unless of course they somehow run out which is ludicrous)

I solve the problem more directly, by asking the people sitting beside me if they would wake me for dinner, snacks, etc. Also, on long flights I suggest  they wake me when they get up to stretch, so I can stretch then too . . . And not have to disturb  ... See More

I once took an Ambien shortly before they handed out the food. The good news was that I was still capable of sleep-eating through my meal. The bad news was that like half the food ended up on my shirt. The weird news was that I was hit by the realization that plane interiors have a "teal and yellow-ochre cathedral-like quality" to them, possibly because I had one of those bizarrely trippy Ambien nods.

I wonder if she was awakened every few minutes the way servers stop by your table in restaurants constantly asking "Is everything okay here?"  They always do it when I'm in mid-bite or have food in my mouth. Annoying. I'm inspired to make a sign that says, "Don't interrupt our meal unless one of us is choking and has turned blue. That will be the signal that "Everything ISN'T okay here."  ;)

My sign would just say "Please don't wake me - for any reason". I don't care if the plane is about to crash. I'll either not feel my death, or be more likely to survive the impact, based on my relaxed state.
As a Deaf woman, this makes sense. How else would I know they are taking orders for drinks and handing out snacks while I was asleep?

My husband and I did this on our flight back from Alaska in 2000. We'd been up for 24 hrs, and I had also taken a Dramamine for motion sickness, so we knew we'd fall asleep and miss the meal. No one woke us, and when we woke up, the meals had already been served.
If it depended on me I'd sleep from take off till landing because of the jetlag pills. People sitting next to me ALWAYS wake me up for meals and such. They're such sweethearts!
There's a cheap airline in Germany that I used to take, that had complimentary eye masks and little stickers to put on it, that signaled to the crew what you did and didn't want to be woken up for.
haha, that's smart, i've actually been stressed out on a plane because i didnt wanna be skipped over for a drink for looking asleep, lol

Hmm, I recall a time flying, first class, to Hong Kong when I availed myself of the provided eye mask that came with a set of stickers that one was supposed to apply directly onto the mask to indicate your awaken/do not awaken preference. I put the "Do ... See More
We made a sign like this for one of our co-workers back in 2003 since he was always falling asleep at work...  He not only kept and framed it, he became the boss a few months later.
Emirates Airlines gives you little stickers to put on the top of your seat back either to wake you or let you sleep during food service. They also give dop cases to everyone, even in coach.

I used to sleep on the ferry between Vancouver and Nanaimo all the time. I'd find a window seat, drape my legs so that my bags were less accessible, bunch up a sweater as a pillow and sleep the majority of the 1 hr 40min ride. I'd set my alarm for just ... See More
Melissa , this woman is my spirit animal. I wish I could go through life only being woken for said treats ... oh and sex. Food and sex.
I dream of a world in which I can actually sleep soundly enough to miss the snacks/drinks on an airplane!
I remember when airlines use to give you stickers to put on your head rest for 'don't wake me up' and 'wake me up for meals'. Standards have slipped.
Zach , we can make a sign that says, "please leave alcohol & cookies on my tray table." Then we will have a surprise treat when we wake up.
